metadata.Title: CVE-2023-23559 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In rndis_query_oid in drivers/net/wireless/rndis_wlan.c in the Linux kernel through 6.1.5, there is an integer overflow in an addition. It was discovered that the RNDIS USB driver in the Linux kernel contained an integer overflow vulnerability. A local attacker with physical access could plug in a malicious USB device to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23559` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-4.15.0-208-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-4.15.0-208-lowlatency - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-lowlatency - 4.15.0-208.220
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> USN-5975-1 first publication included esm/xenial linux-gcp version 4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1 by mistake, it got fixed in version 4.15.0-1147.163~16.04.1 as published in USN-6009-1.
